data.title: Stray Dogs (1985)
data.meta_description: A fan tries to get an artist's attention by literally coming apart.
data.text:
NECESSARY PSA!!! this is why it is SUPER IMPORTANT for queer people to have their sexual & emotional needs met A$AP by other queer people also requiring their sexual & emotional needs met!!! gay sex is a matter of life and death bc when u really need ur partner to pay attention to u physically and not, u know, do something STUPID like walk home from their errand, use the ATM or complete their art bc it is generally known that unless queer people have sex every half hour, they get super-antsy as their bodies r beginning to discorporate from all of the pressure of the blood building up inside that otherwise will money shot out of their eyes up to a…

Last night I went to the Tyneside cinema to see a programme of films celebrating the fortieth anniversary of punk rock (inasmuch as something like that can be tied to a date). It kicked off with this Richard Kern short, which even without the director's ties to the likes of Sonic Youth and Henry Rollins would be identifiably punk in its limitations and strengths. It is a messy, scrappy film, shot on locations that Kern clearly didn't have permits for, occasionally going out of focus, featuring loudly one-note performances and some of the worst post-sync dubbing I've ever heard. There are also things wrong with it.

Stray Dogs centres around the artist and AIDS activist David Wojnarowicz as a twitchy…
